static final byte DEFAULT_TRANSPARENCY = (byte) 200

Detailed Description

Writes a spatial grid out as PNG file.

Author:
Valliappa.Lakshmanan

a colormap that goes from green to red through white.

static IndexColorModel edu.ou.asgbook.io.PngWriter.createGrayScaleColormap (  )  [static]

black-to-white colormap 

00052                                                            {
00053         byte[] red = new byte[256];
00054         byte[] alpha = new byte[red.length];
00055         for (int i=0; i < red.length; ++i){
00056             red[i] = (byte) i;
00057         }
00058         alpha[0] = 0;
00059         for (int i=1; i < alpha.length; ++i){
00060             alpha[i] = DEFAULT_TRANSPARENCY;
00061         }
00062         IndexColorModel colormap = new IndexColorModel(16, red.length, red, red, red, alpha);
00063         return colormap;
00064     }

static IndexColorModel edu.ou.asgbook.io.PngWriter.createHotColormap (  )  [static]

a colormap that goes from blue to red through purple 

00069                                                      {
00070         byte[] red = new byte[256];
00071         byte[] green = new byte[red.length];
00072         byte[] blue = new byte[red.length];
00073         byte[] alpha = new byte[red.length];
00074         for (int i=0; i < red.length; ++i){
00075             red[i] = (byte) i;
00076             blue[i] = (byte)( 255 - red[i]);
00077             green[i] = (byte)( (red[i] + blue[i])/2 );
00078         }
00079         alpha[0] = 0;
00080         for (int i=1; i < alpha.length; ++i){
00081             alpha[i] = DEFAULT_TRANSPARENCY;
00082         }
00083         IndexColorModel colormap = new IndexColorModel(16, red.length, red, green, blue, alpha);
00084         return colormap;
00085     }

static IndexColorModel edu.ou.asgbook.io.PngWriter.createRandomColormap (  )  [static]

Randomized colormap, useful for displaying object labels, for example where the datavalues themselves do not mean anything beyond being a means to distinguish between objects. 

00142                                                         {
00143         byte[] red = new byte[256];
00144         byte[] green = new byte[red.length];
00145         byte[] blue = new byte[red.length];
00146         byte[] alpha = new byte[red.length];
00147         
00148         Random rnd = new Random();
00149         
00150         // random colors for the three channels
00151         for (int i=0; i < red.length; ++i){
00152             red[i] = (byte) rnd.nextInt(255);
00153             green[i] = (byte) rnd.nextInt(255);
00154             blue[i] = (byte) rnd.nextInt(255);
00155         }
00156         
00157         // 0 is transparent; everything else is opaque
00158         alpha[0] = 0;
00159         for (int i=1; i < alpha.length; ++i){
00160             alpha[i] = DEFAULT_TRANSPARENCY;
00161         }
00162         
00163         IndexColorModel colormap = new IndexColorModel(16, red.length, red, green, blue, alpha);
00164         return colormap;
00165     }

static void edu.ou.asgbook.io.PngWriter.main ( String[]  args  )  throws Exception [static] 

00195                                                             {
00196         LatLonGrid grid = new LatLonGrid(100, 200, -1, new LatLon(35,-97), 0.1, 0.1);
00197         for (int i=0; i < grid.getNumLat(); ++i){
00198             for (int j=0; j < grid.getNumLon(); ++j){
00199                 grid.getData()[i][j] = i + j;
00200                 if ( i%10 == 0 || j%20 == 0){
00201                     grid.getData()[i][j] = grid.getMissing();
00202                 }
00203             }
00204         }
00205         
00206         File outdir = OutputDirectory.getDefault("pngwriter");
00207         File out = new File(outdir.getAbsoluteFile() + "/autoscaled_cooltowarm.png");
00208         PngWriter.writeAutoScaled(grid, out, PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00209         
00210         out = new File(outdir.getAbsoluteFile() + "/autoscaled_hot.png");
00211         PngWriter.writeAutoScaled(grid, out, PngWriter.createHotColormap());
00212         
00213         out = new File(outdir.getAbsoluteFile() + "/autoscaled_gray.png");
00214         PngWriter.writeAutoScaled(grid, out, PngWriter.createGrayScaleColormap());
00215         
00216         out = new File(outdir.getAbsoluteFile() + "/scaled_0_10.png");
00217         PngWriter.writeScaled(grid, out, 10, 100, PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00218     }

static void edu.ou.asgbook.io.PngWriter.writeAutoScaled ( LatLonGrid  grid,
File  outputFile,
ColorModel  colormap 
) throws Exception [static] 

00025                                                                                                                {
00026         // find min, max in data
00027         int[][] data = grid.getData();
00028         int min = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
00029         int max = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
00030         int numvalid = 0;
00031         for (int i=0; i < data.length; ++i){
00032             for (int j=0; j < data[0].length; ++j){
00033                 if ( data[i][j] != grid.getMissing() ){
00034                     ++numvalid;
00035                     if ( data[i][j] < min ){
00036                         min = data[i][j];
00037                     }
00038                     if ( data[i][j] > max ){
00039                         max = data[i][j];
00040                     }
00041                 }
00042             }
00043         }
00044         System.out.println("Autoscaling " + numvalid + " valid pixels between " + min + " and " + max);
00045         writeScaled(grid, outputFile, min, max, colormap);
00046     }

static void edu.ou.asgbook.io.PngWriter.writeScaled ( LatLonGrid  grid,
File  outputFile,
int  min,
int  max,
ColorModel  colormap 
) throws Exception [static] 

00167                                                                                                                              {  
00168         // scale the data and lookup the color
00169         int[][] data = grid.getData();
00170         double scale = 255.0 / (max - min + 1); // first is for 'missing'
00171         BufferedImage result = new BufferedImage(grid.getNumLon(), grid.getNumLat(), BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB);
00172         for (int i=0; i < data.length; ++i){
00173             for (int j=0; j < data[0].length; ++j){
00174                 int scaled = 0;
00175                 if ( data[i][j] == grid.getMissing() ){
00176                     scaled = 0;
00177                 } else if ( data[i][j] < min ){
00178                     // System.out.println(data[i][j] + " " + scaled);
00179                     scaled = 0;
00180                 } else if ( data[i][j] >= max ){
00181                     scaled = 255;
00182                 } else {
00183                     scaled = (int) ( (data[i][j]-min) * scale + 1.5);
00184                 }
00185                 
00186                 result.setRGB(j, i, colormap.getRGB(scaled));
00187             }
00188         }
00189     
00190         // write it out
00191         ImageIO.write(result, "png", outputFile);
00192         System.out.println("Wrote " + outputFile + " by scaling data between " + min + " and " + max);
00193     }
